content:
Sure! Here are some off-the-beaten-path museums to consider visiting in Rome:

1. Centrale Montemartini - This museum is housed in an old power station and features classical sculptures alongside engines and turbines.

2. Villa Farnesina - A beautiful Renaissance villa that features frescoes and artwork by Raphael.

3. Palazzo Massimo alle Terme - An underrated museum that houses a vast collection of ancient Roman art and artifacts.

4. Crypta Balbi - This museum is located in the remains of an ancient Roman theater and showcases the layers of Rome's history.

5. Museo Nazionale Etrusco di Villa Giulia - Located just outside the city center, this museum is devoted to the Etruscan civilization that predates ancient Rome.

6. Chiostro del Bramante - A former monastery turned exhibition center, it showcases contemporary art and photography.

I hope this helps! Enjoy exploring Rome's museums!
